event: Cooperation Agreement between Laverov Center and Myanmar
description: The Laverov Center and Myanmar have formed a cooperation agreement to preserve biodiversity in Myanmar, focusing on freshwater invertebrates. Russian biologists will create a guidebook on freshwater mollusks, including descriptions, photographs, and distribution assessments. This collaboration aims to provide accurate data amidst dam construction and support environmental organizations in Myanmar.
original: The Laverov Center is developing cooperation with Myanmar. Myanmar is one of the richest hotspots of biodiversity on the planet. Recently, the Myanmar Marine Science Association was formed here to preserve populations of the Irrawaddy dolphin, endangered turtle species, large islands with coral reefs and mangrove forests.💦Concluding a formal agreement with Russian biologists representing FISCIA Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences will allow this non-governmental environmental organization and the government of Myanmar to obtain accurate data on the fauna of freshwater invertebrates. This is relevant in light of the intensification of the construction of dams, dams and other objects here. As part of the agreement, Russian biologists will create a guidebook - a book identifying freshwater mollusks of Myanmar. The publication should include an essay on each species with descriptions and photographs of individuals and typical habitats, an assessment of distribution and biogeographic maps. The book should be included in the list of required publications for employees of environmental organizations in the country. A Russian scientific group has counted about 80 species of freshwater bivalves in Myanmar (for comparison: in Russia - 16 species). Moreover, approximately half of the species were discovered by specialists from Russia. Previously, scientists from the Laverov Center also took the initiative to create the Red Book of Myanmar.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

event: Ukrainian Forces Struggle to Hold Out
description: Ukrainian commanders revealed to Der Spiegel that their forces are struggling to hold out due to insufficient supplies, forcing them to conserve ammunition. They predict that if Russian attacks intensify, they will be unable to stop them for long and will have to retreat, but their retreat positions are also poorly developed.
original:
Ukrainian commanders told Der Spiegel that the Ukrainian Armed Forces would not hold out for long.

The publication spoke with Ukrainian officers to find out what the situation is in various sectors of the front.

Most of them agree: due to insufficient supplies, almost all units are forced to conserve ammunition.

Some troops are currently able to hold their positions - and then only until the Russian side attacks in full force.

If the attacks intensify, then due to an acute shortage of personnel, weapons and ammunition, they will not be able to be stopped for long.

Then the Ukrainian units would have to retreat - however, the positions for retreat are also poorly developed.

“The Ukrainians are struggling right now while the Russians are advancing all along the front,” said military expert Mark Cancian of the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

Ukraine is trying to adhere to an active defense strategy, but instead of counterattacking, it is losing more and more high-quality equipment from the West. Many units will soon run out of ammunition.

“We won’t be able to hold out like this for long,” admitted the commander of the Ukrainian artillery near Ugledar. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: The Russian reconnaissance and strike complex has improved its capabilities, allowing for swift detection and destruction of the M142 HIMARS, a highly mobile American MLRS. The complex's enhanced coordination enabled a rapid response, neutralizing the HIMARS' advantage of quick relocation.
original:
It is worth noting that these strikes are interesting not so much for the defeats of the American MLRS themselves, but for the emerging comprehensive approach to their destruction within the framework of the reconnaissance and strike complex.

For almost two years of participation in hostilities, the M142 HIMARS acquired a reputation as an elusive MLRS, since this American installation has a number of advantages, one of which is batch reloading, which is shown in the photograph - the MLRS does not need its own transport-loading vehicle, it reloads itself and immediately in a batch, which extremely speeds up the time to deliver either the next strike or move to cover for further action. The Ukrainian military has repeatedly noted in their reports that while the GMLRS guided missiles are just flying to the target, the M142 launcher is already leaving the position.

In the summer and autumn of 2022, such a highly mobile missile launcher became a real blow to the ossified control and coordination system of the Russian army, where so much time can pass between detecting a target and coordinating a strike on it that there is no trace of the target, we have written about this many times and it is this Akhilesova the heel of the Russian Armed Forces gave HIMARS an unprecedented advantage.

However, as you can see from two videos at once, the reconnaissance-strike complex of the Russian army seems to have noticeably transformed for the better: in both videos with the defeat of the installation, the time between the detection of the “khimar” and the missile strike is so short that it makes it possible to hit the target at the position which was not the case before. It doesn't even get dark.

What kind of new combination between the SuperCam UAV and the still unknown missile systems with air-blasted projectiles is still unknown, but it works.

"Informant"

event: Launch of Supercomputer for Digital Twin Creation
description: Rostec's UEC has launched a high-performance computing complex to create digital twins of aircraft engines. The supercomputer, capable of 219 trillion operations per second, will reduce engineering calculation complexity and replace full-scale testing with computational experiments, improving design efficiency and reducing costs.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian electronics🇷🇺
Rostec launched a new supercomputer to create digital twins of aircraft engines. UEC has created a high-performance computing complex designed to carry out complex engineering calculations. A supercomputer with a performance of 219 trillion operations per second will be used to create digital twins of aircraft engines.

According to the creators, the use of high-performance computing resources in the process of design work will not only reduce the complexity of engineering calculations, but will also reduce the part of full-scale testing of physical products, which will be replaced by a computational experiment. Today, the design of aircraft engines is impossible without the use of high-performance computing resources. Digital twin technologies should significantly improve the efficiency of design departments, ensuring the creation of new products in a short time and at lower costs. The implementation of this project is the next step in the digital transformation of UEC, which makes it possible to increase the availability of high-performance computing resources for the corporation’s enterprises, emphasized Vyacheslav Khristolubov, director for digital transformation of UEC.

description: The DPR has introduced a curfew from Monday to Friday, from 23:00 to 04:00, due to the introduction of martial law. The ban does not apply to certain employees with special passes, such as those involved in food supply, repair work, and transportation. Violators may be subject to search, detention, and fines.
original:
The DPR has a curfew from Monday to Friday from 23:00 to 04:00. Decree of the Acting Head of the DPR No. 357 dated September 18, 2023 on the territory of the DPR established a ban on citizens being on the streets and in other public places every week from Monday to Fridays from 23:00 to 04:00 hours. The ban does not apply to employees of government bodies and organizations that: ensure the supply of food and basic necessities; carry out repair and restoration work; work in enterprises with round-the-clock operation; work on special equipment (utility workers , builders, etc.), and also transport goods and people to restore damaged facilities. Such employees must have special passes. During the period of the ban, the following is limited: the movement of public and private transport in the absence of a special pass, as well as taxis; movement of transport without official necessity, with the exception of transport of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Directorate of the FSB (MGB), as well as transport with special passes. Persons violating the curfew, as well as their personal belongings, may be subject to search, and, if there are grounds, detained for the purpose of investigation for a period of no more than 48 hours. Cars may also be detained on which violators travel without a special pass.

       These restrictions are introduced in connection with the introduction of martial law on the territory of the DPR from October 20, 2022. More details in this article 🚷 AND THE MOST IMPORTANT: violation of the martial law regime is punishable by a fine in the amount of 500 rubles to 1 thousand rubles (for officials - from 1 to 2 thousand rubles .)or administrative arrest for up to 30 days (Part 1 of Article 20.5.1 of the Administrative Code👈).
       And if you drive a car during curfew without a pass, then this car may be confiscated! (Part 2 of Article 20.5.1 of the Code of Administrative Offenses👈).🇷🇺Official website of the administration🏛Head of Administration of the Volnovakha Municipal District Subscribe to the channel VKontakteOdnoklassniki

event: Development of Robotic System for Power Line Maintenance
description: Engineers from Laboratory of the Future developed a robotic system based on the Spider drone to cut and braid tangled power line wires and cables. The system can also install repair clamps, signal balls, and other devices without disconnecting the line. The Spider drone has a carrying capacity of 20 kg and is expected to hit the market in May, increasing power supply reliability and reducing repair time.
original:
Forwarded from: Dronoflot
Engineers from Laboratory of the Future, a drone development company, were able to solve one of the current problems of electric power industry. They created and successfully tested a robotic system based on the Spider drone for cutting tangles of steel-aluminum wires and lightning cables of power lines. Unraveling of wires is a common occurrence today, which occurs due to lightning strikes or corrosion and leads to short circuits and long-term outages of power lines.

The Laboratory of the Future team managed to create a manipulator capable of braiding fallen strands of wires and cables, and if braiding is impossible, trimming them.

In addition, the Spider platform can be equipped with various robotic systems, such as a system for installing repair clamps, signal balls, short circuit indicators, bird alarms and other power line devices, without disconnecting the line, all work is carried out under voltage.

The Spider's carrying capacity is 20 kg, which makes it possible to further expand its functionality not only for the needs of the electric power industry, but also for other industries. The development cost does not exceed 2 million rubles. It will hit the market in May. We are confident that the development will be a success, because it has no analogues, its implementation will increase the reliability of power supply to consumers, reduce the time for repair work, and its use does not require disconnecting power lines for repair work, which saves money from electric grid companies. Dronoflot

As the search party said, the fighter will be reburied with full military honors.

#twenty years ago03/12/2004. IL-76 RA-76388 Dobrolyot.
In the afternoon, while landing at the destination airport of Irkutsk, Russia, a serious incident occurred with an Il-76 aircraft.
A charter cargo flight was carried out on the route Shijiazhuan (China) - Irkutsk (Russia). In accordance with the transportation documents, there was cargo weighing 44,890 kg on board the aircraft.
According to the control weighing report, the weight of the cargo was 58,300 kg, the aircraft was removed from further operation until its airworthiness was determined in the prescribed manner.
The operator's certificate of the Dobrolyot airline was cancelled. It was noted that copies of accompanying documentation for the cargo received at the request of the State Civil Aviation Authority from the aviation authorities of the People's Republic of China had nothing in common with the documentation held by the crews of the aircraft, which indicated facts of falsification when registering the cargo in airports in China.

description: 33-year-old soldier Denys Kucherenko, call sign Kim, died on August 10, 2023, while performing a combat mission near Ponyativka in the Kherson region. He was at the helm of the boat when Ukrainian soldiers were crossing the Dnipro River and came under mortar fire. Denys managed to get the group out of the shelling but died from a mine fragment.
original:
Together with the Memorial Platform, Fokus honors the memory of fallen soldiers.

33-year-old soldier Denys Kucherenko, call sign Kim, died on August 10, 2023 while performing a combat mission near the village of Ponyativka in the Kherson region. The soldier was at the helm of the boat when Ukrainian soldiers were crossing the Dnipro River. The ship came under mortar fire. Denys managed to get the group out of the shelling, but he himself died from a mine fragment.

Denis comes from the village of Stepanivka, Odesa region. Graduated from high school. Then he did not go to study, because he had to work to raise his two younger sisters, who were under his care. Lived in Odessa. His last profession in peaceful life was an auto mechanic. He liked fishing and cooking. And he also dreamed of creating a family, because it was the most important thing in his life. Denys month did not live to see his wedding.

During the full-scale invasion, the man did not stand aside and joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. He served in the 126th separate territorial defense brigade. Was a scout.

During his service, Denys was awarded the diploma "For faithful performance of official duties, courage, courage and professionalism, demonstrated during participation in measures to ensure national security and defense", the order "Veteran of War" and posthumously - the badge "Badge of Honor" " for achievements discovered during his lifetime. "I am Denis's fiancee, although he always said that she was his wife. We have been together for 14 years. This is a person who really dreamed of living. He had a difficult childhood and a very difficult life. He dreamed of building a family, but he always said that after the war, because first of all - the people and the country, to which he swore. He volunteered from the very beginning of the invasion and dreamed of remaining in the ranks of the defenders after the war. He was a cheerful person who knew how to enjoy every moment. He was a faithful friend, always ready to help. And his main principles were truth and justice," said Alla Gavdzinska.

The soldier was buried in his native village.

Denys is survived by his mother, stepfather, two sisters, son and fiancée.

According to lawyers interviewed by Kommersant, putting him on the wanted list does not pose any direct risks for the businessman’s Russian assets, but accusations from the Kyrgyz authorities could negatively affect the company’s reputation and undermine investor confidence in it. event: Fire in Warehouse near Southern Thermal Power Plant
description: A fire broke out in a warehouse building near the Southern Thermal Power Plant in St. Petersburg, but did not affect the plant's functioning. Ukrainian propagandists spread misinformation, claiming the fire occurred at the power plant itself.
original:
Fake: The most powerful city power plant, the Southern Thermal Power Plant, is on fire in St. Petersburg, Ukrainian Telegram channels write. Truth: There are no fires on the territory of the Southern Thermal Power Plant, the fire occurred in a warehouse at a distance from the station and did not in any way affect its functioning.

The fake was denied by the energy company PJSC TGK-1, which includes the thermal power plant. Ukrainian propagandists took advantage of the angle of photographs of the fire taken from afar. They give the impression that a column of smoke is rising from a cooling tower on the station grounds.

In fact, pallets caught fire in a warehouse building on another territory, the Ministry of Emergency Situations reported. The area of the fire was 80 square meters, there is no threat of spreading to neighboring buildings. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

description: During the March holidays, there was an increase in Telegram account hijackings. Scammers created groups, asking users to vote for the chat organizer by following a link. “On the pre-holidays and holidays of March 6–10, cases of hacking of Telegram accounts with a similar scenario became more frequent. Fraudsters created groups of several dozen people in the messenger on behalf of a common contact. A message was circulated in these groups asking people to vote for the chat organizer in the competition, for which they had to follow a link. If the link was followed by a user who did not have two-factor authentication enabled, the scammers gained access to his account, and the account owner was kicked out of the application.
Then, on behalf of the victim, a message was sent to the contact list with a request to borrow several tens of thousands of rubles “for a couple of hours.”

event: Biden Administration's Defense Budget Request for FY2025
description: The Biden administration's defense budget request for FY2025 prioritizes modernization programs and countering China, with minimal military assistance for Ukraine. The budget excludes large purchases of ammunition and modernization of production bases, instead focusing on sea mines and other areas.
original:
Forwarded from: Nuclear Petrel
Sat down for the Biden administration's defense budget request for FY2025.
Of course, it may not be worth the effort - the States have been living without a budget for six months (the fiscal year begins on October 1 of the previous calendar year, that is, FY2024 began on 10/01/23). However, someday they will probably accept it, just like for 2025 - even a replacement in the White House will not have time to change it much (then nothing will definitely be accepted in a year)
Against the background of the cuts, the priorities of the American military are visible. Particularly important modernization programs and all topics related to countering China received full funding and maximum security.
But there is actually no conventional Ukrainian theme in the budget. In its main body, military assistance is minimal, even for the “European Deterrence Initiative” (which involves the deployment of forces in Europe and part of the training) allocated three times less than for the “Pacific”. It is much more interesting that the budget completely excludes large purchases of ammunition and modernization of the base for its production. Purchases of 155-mm shells are being cut against the backdrop of rising spending on sea mines (sic!).
The reason, in my opinion, is obvious - the budget was written against the backdrop of the nomination of the big “hundred-billionaire” Biden to Congress, into which, amid budget cuts, the US military pushed everything they could. Now, without accepting it in some form, they will look very pale, since it turns out they themselves did not ask for a replacement for what they spent.
Well, this means that I have always said that the variations of this bill have always been primarily about the American armed forces and the military-industrial complex, and not about anyone else.
By topic:
- hyperoks are generally financed. ARRW is not in the budget, after all. LRHW and HACM make good money. MRC and Marine tomahawks continue to be produced
- in the triad, B-21, LRSO and Columbia receive full support. Sentinel has been trimmed a bit, possibly amid overspending scandals
- SLCM-N is not in the budget, but the NNSA request leaves the door open for it to appear if the FY2024 budget passes with it. B61-12 should be completed as a series in 2025. B61-13 is planned in series in 2026-28.

event: Meeting between Sadyr Japarov and Bakytzhan Sagintayev
description: Kyrgyzstan President Sadyr Japarov met with Eurasian Economic Commission Chairman Bakytzhan Sagintayev to discuss cooperation within the Eurasian Economic Union and deepening integration in the Eurasian space. Japarov emphasized the need to create a full-fledged economic Union, citing unresolved domestic market problems. Sagintayev highlighted the Union's dynamic development and efforts to resolve trade barriers.
original:
Forwarded from: New Turkestan Gazette
🇰🇬Sadyr Japarov received the Chairman of the Board of the Eurasian Economic Commission (EEC) Bakytzhan Sagintayev. According to the press service of the President of Kyrgyzstan, issues of cooperation within the framework of Kyrgyzstan’s membership in the Eurasian Economic Union, as well as deepening and expanding integration in the Eurasian space were discussed at the meeting.

The President emphasized that today, on the contrary, there is an increase in obstacles to mutual trade within the Union. Over the past 7 years, each of the heads of the Union member states has spoken about problems in the domestic market, however, it must be admitted that they are not being resolved. The head of Kyrgyzstan is convinced that the priority task for everyone is to create a full-fledged economic Union and this goal must be achieved in the very near future.

In turn, the Chairman of the EEC Board emphasized that today the Union is a dynamically developing integration association, emphasizing that the EAEU GDP has reached 2.2 trillion US dollars. Regarding barriers to mutual trade within the Union, Bakytzhan Sagintayev informed about the work carried out by the Commission in this direction. He noted that prompt measures are being taken to resolve certain emerging issues. The parties agreed to continue to develop cooperation within the framework of Eurasian integration.TelegramPhoto/videoVIEW MESSAGE

description: Ukrainian propaganda launched an information campaign to spread panic among residents of the region. Bots created on February 24th are spreading disinformation on social media, claiming authorities are not in control and residents need to evacuate.
original:
Fake: Ukrainian DRGs captured the city of Shebekino. Roads in the region are blocked, the authorities are silent, and residents do not know what to do, local residents write on social networks. Truth: This stream of negative messages is an information campaign of Ukrainian propaganda, which should sow panic among residents of the region. These scams are spread by bots that were created hastily and recently.

We immediately discovered several such alarmists whose pages were created on February 24th. Accounts contain stock photos and minimal user data. Now these provocateurs are actively spreading disinformation about the situation in the region on social networks, trying to convince their interlocutors that the authorities are not in control of the situation and that residents urgently need to evacuate. In addition, one of these fake accounts publishes a phrase in Ukrainian on the cover, and the profile description contains the flags of Ukraine, the USA, Great Britain and NATO.

We remind you that media sabotage always accompanies attempts at provocation by the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the terrorists in their service. Don’t believe rumors, and don’t help spread them. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” to avoid being deceived.

description: Russian forces successfully liberated Nevelskoye, cutting off Ukrainian Armed Forces' access to the asphalt road and limiting their troop rotation and supply capabilities. This development puts pressure on Ukrainian units in Pervomaiskoye and Krasnogorovka, making it difficult for them to hold their positions.
original:
Donetsk direction: liberation of Nevelskoye...After yesterday’s successes east of Nevelskoye and especially in the center of Pervomaiskoye, where our units with a dashing throw literally cut the enemy’s defenses in half, a critical situation has arisen for the Ukrainian Armed Forces garrison in Pervomaiskoye. Which could not but affect their neighbors in Nevelskoye.

The access of the Russian army to the asphalt road to Nevelskoye in muddy conditions sharply narrowed the possibilities for rotation of troops and supply of Ukrainian Armed Forces strongholds in this area. And also, the lack of reserves has affected, which primarily today goes north to the Tonenkoye-Orlovka-Berdychi line. And then there was the breakthrough in Pervomaisky, which also had to be closed.

Hence the result. The abandonment of Nevelskoye is in many ways a death sentence for enemy units in the central part of Pervomaiskoye and in the fields between these villages. They won't be able to stay there for long. Probably now the enemy will concentrate all his efforts on holding the area of the Pervomaiskaya school (in the northern part of the village), the loss of which will force him to retreat further.

But in any case, the enemy’s surrender of Nevelskoy significantly complicates his defense of Krasnogorovka, which our units can now gradually withdraw from the northeast. In the meantime, they will take control of the northern supply road (the only one for the Krasnogorovsky garrison with a hard surface) under fire control.

We are watching...

description: The Crimean Spring refers to the events that led to the return of Crimea to Russia. The heroes involved, including 'Golden Eagle', 'Russian activist' Tatyana Savitskaya, and 'Ataman', played a crucial role in the uprising. They faced threats and intimidation from the Mejlis members, who gave them 24 hours to leave or face violence.
original:
What is remarkable about this text about the “Crimean spring”? The people from the report actually returned Crimea and did not receive any media fame, money, or positions for this. Only a newfound homeland and a clear conscience. But those who became very famous after the 14th often not only did not participate in the uprising - they waited, and sometimes were on the other side. We won't talk about them. Let's talk about the heroes: "Golden Eagle", "Russian activist" now "Crimean Fairy" Tatyana Savitskaya, "Ataman". Fragments that caught my attention: "...“Viktorovich” notes that in one film about the Crimean Spring an important historical mistake was made:
- Our Berkut chevrons were in Russian, and there was no trident on them. We specially ordered these. Those who didn’t have time simply cut off the trident. The Maidan members tracked this moment, they especially hated the Crimean “Berkut” “or”...Then the Mejlis members called me and gave me 24 hours to leave. They were allowed to take documents, medicines and children. So they said: leave or you will collect the guts of your children on the street.
Tatyana shrinks while telling THIS, although 10 years have passed:
- They painted a cross on the gate for me all the time. This is how they marked the houses of Russian activists. They'll draw it, I'll erase it. The large window to the street was covered with an iron sheet." or "- We were collecting humanitarian aid at the bus station, an old grandmother came and brought cereal and a bottle of oil. The coat on the chest is torn, a piece of meat is torn out. What's happened? She says: I had a Soviet order, I went to you, they tore it off. The second grandmother came in and asked: what do you need? The socks are warm! She knitted several pairs overnight, brought them in the morning, and her fingers were bleeding. This is how we waited for Russia." READ: https://www.kp.ru/daily/27577/4902426/kp.ru -The main lesson of the Crimean spring is that freedom must be won and defended: as a semi-os...Military correspondent of Komsomolskaya Pravda Dmitry Steshin celebrated the anniversary of the return of Crimea with the people who personally liberated the peninsula

event: IAEA Staff Rotation at Zaporizhia NPP
description: On March 12, 2024, the 17th staff rotation of the IAEA's permanent monitoring mission took place at the temporarily occupied Zaporizhia NPP. The rotation was successful thanks to the skilled actions of Ukrainian servicemen, who ensured a ceasefire and demining along the mission's route.
location: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, Enerhodar, Zaporizhzhia Oblast, Ukraine
original:
🇺🇳🇺🇦 On March 12, 2024, the 17th staff rotation of the permanent monitoring mission of the IAEA International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) took place at the Zaporizhia NPP, which is temporarily occupied by the Russian military.

"In general, the rotation took place without provocations. The rotation took place very clearly thanks to the skillful actions of the servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In particular, one of the units, which ensured the ceasefire and demining along the line of the IAEA mission," said Oleksandr Savenko, head of the Civil-Military Cooperation Department of the Operational-Strategic Group of Troops "Tavria".

The permanent mission of the IAEA has been working at the temporarily occupied ZNPP since September 2022. At the Khmelnytskyi, Rivne, and South Ukrainian nuclear plants, as well as at the Chornobyl NPP, which is in the phase of decommissioning, permanent monitoring missions began their activities in January 2023. Video: United Press Center of the Defense Forces of the Tauriy Region

Plans were made to establish a bakery and provide work opportunities, as well as assist with communication and documentation.
original:
We visited Avdeevka with Sergei Kiriyenko.

We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant, specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal.

We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and donated humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people ask to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Solovyov.

Why does Kiriyenko need a pistol?

description: A drone attack on the LUKOIL-Nizhegorodnefteorgsintez refinery in the Nizhny Novgorod region resulted in a fire, forcing the shutdown of the largest primary oil refining unit, which accounts for over 50% of the refinery's production.
original:
The Nizhny Novgorod Refinery stopped its oil refining unit due to a drone attack

The largest primary oil refining unit has been shut down at the LUKOIL oil refinery in the Nizhny Novgorod region, a source at the enterprise told Kommersant. According to him, the installation was stopped after a fire due to a drone attack.

According to Reuters sources, the LUKOIL-Nizhegorodnefteorgsintez refinery, as a result of a UAV attack, damaged the AVT-6 unit, which provides more than 50% of the refinery’s production.

Earlier today, the governor of the Nizhny Novgorod region, Gleb Nikitin, reported that a drone attacked a fuel and energy complex facility in the Kstovo industrial zone, and a fire occurred at one of the oil refining installations.

The LUKOIL-Nizhegorodnefteorgsintez refinery can process about 17 million tons of oil per year. This enterprise produces 11% of the gasoline produced in Russia, writes Reuters. https://t.me/+TwWu0hyEb50bn-IL

description: A military transport plane, IL-76, crashed in a forest plantation near the Severny airfield in the Ivanovo region. original:
A military transport plane crashed in the Ivanovo region. First of all, we are talking about the IL-76. It fell a little short of the runway of the Severny airfield and crashed in a forest plantation
Crew 12 people. The plane was diverted away from residential areas.
The reasons for the crash are being clarified based on the Il-76 crash near Ivanovo. Our guess. The video shows that after turning off the engine and triggering the SPT, the smoke trail disappears, but after a few seconds it appears again in two places on the same plane. This happens when an engine is destroyed, when the compressor blades fly apart like fragments and chop everything along the way - in particular, fuel lines and damage the neighboring engine, putting it out of action as well. And when two engines exit on the same plane at low speed and low altitude, there is no longer a chance of landing the plane. Subscribe to Ramsay!

description: Ukrainian forces continue to shell Russian territory. In response, recommendations have been issued for actions to take during shelling, including seeking shelter, avoiding panic, and carrying basic medical supplies.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Observer
Shelling of Russian territory by Ukrainian forces continues.

We give our recommendations for actions in the event of shelling: 1. If you are at home, when an alarm sounds or you hear explosions, go into the most secure room or corridor in an apartment or house.

2. If possible, close the doors and windows, leave a pre-written sign “We are in the basement” if you are taking refuge in the basement of a private house.

3. If you are on the street in the city, when the alarm sounds, take shelter as quickly as possible in a nearby building or bomb shelter.

4. If you hear explosions or if there are no buildings nearby, lie down on the ground and cover your head with your hands.

5. If you are in a car, stop, leave the car, take shelter in a building or bomb shelter. If there are no buildings nearby, leave the car, lie down on the ground and cover your head with your hands. If you cannot leave the car, bend down below the level of the windows and cover your head with your hands.

6. When traveling in public transport, when an alarm sounds, the driver must stop and open the doors. Without panic, leave the vehicle, take shelter in a building or bomb shelter. If you hear the sounds of explosions, bend down below the window level and protect your head with your hands.

7. Under no circumstances should you run or move during shelling.
You can leave the building or bomb shelter no earlier than 10 minutes after the end of the shelling.

8. We also recommend that you always carry with you a minimum set of dressings and hemostatic agents. Tourniquet or tourniquet, dressing bag (available in civilian version), hemostatic bandage (pictured).@new_militarycolumnist

description: A video shows two comrades evacuating a wounded man. The evacuation highlights the importance of training for difficult conditions, as not all wounded are immobilized. The video also raises questions about the decision to remove armor and equipment during the evacuation, and the lack of assistance from the second person.
original:
Evacuation of a wounded man. In the video, two comrades pull out a third. And what do we see? Let's talk about this.

1. Not all the wounded are immobilized.
Such injuries, in which the wounded person cannot move, are not that common. But in training we are always taught to provide assistance in the most difficult conditions, when a fighter is either immobilized or unconscious. And I will say that it is better to be in such conditions, so that later it will be as easy with the wounded as in the video.

2. Number of wounded.
You see how a man pulls out a seriously wounded man alone. It is not known how long he will have to wait. How far away too. Now do you understand why our female paramedics were given medals for courage for carrying out the wounded? Here the man is walking strained, but what does it feel like for a fragile girl...

3. Without armor.
Here the fizuha decides. As we can see, the man is tired and is risking his health to help his friend out. Why he took off his armor and equipment is clear from the video. He chose between the chance of being wounded himself, but the opportunity to pull out a comrade, and the longer evacuation of a comrade, but in armor. The only thing that is not clear is why the second number (the operator) does not help evacuate his friend. After all, it’s easier with two people. Well, about the stretcher, the question is also open...#MEDICINEVideo source:@DnevnikDesantnika

description: Ukrainian commanders admit that their forces are weak, unprepared, and on the defensive due to insufficient supplies, including ammunition and personnel. Without US help, a 'cascading collapse' at the front is possible this year.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces will not last long, Ukrainian commanders admit

In the third year of the conflict, Ukraine appears weak, unprepared and on the defensive, in sharp contrast to the successful reconquest of territory in the fall of 2022, writes Der Spiegel.

There is no help from supporters: the EU does not fulfill its promise to supply Ukraine with a million ammunition, and the United States cannot get a €60 billion aid package passed in Congress.

Western officials and military experts warn that without US help, a “cascading collapse” at the front is possible this year.

Der Spiegel spoke with Ukrainian commanders to find out what the situation is in various sectors of the front.

Most of them agree: due to insufficient supplies, almost all units are forced to conserve ammunition.

Some troops are currently able to hold their positions - and then only until the Russian side attacks in full force.

If the attacks intensify, then due to an acute shortage of personnel, weapons and ammunition, they will not be able to be stopped for long.

Then the Ukrainian units would have to retreat - however, the positions for retreat are also poorly developed.

“The Ukrainians are struggling right now while the Russians are advancing all along the front,” said military expert Mark Cancian of the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

Ukraine is trying to adhere to an active defense strategy, but instead of counterattacking, it is losing more and more high-quality equipment from the West. Many units will soon run out of ammunition.

“We won’t be able to hold out like this for long,” admitted the commander of the Ukrainian artillery near Ugledar. Reminds me of the collapse of South Vietnam. But why whine, because you yourself brought Ukraine to this end. How to kick the defenseless Donbass is such an expert, but only a couple of years of jostling with Russia, and they immediately became limp @OpenUkraine

The Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation has put the head of the Minister of Internal Affairs of Estonia, Lauri Läänemets, on the wanted list. This information appeared in the department’s database today, March 12.

“A wanted notice provides a fully legitimate tool for action, including arrest. We all know and understand perfectly well that this kind of reaction never occurs in an empty and level place. In this case, we are talking and stating the sad fact that these three specific individuals are not only behaving from the point of view of aggressive Russophobic policies, but are also taking specific actions to rewrite history and desecrate those monuments that are not just important to us, but and carry a deep cultural, semantic and moral factor of meaning,” noted Khamzaev.

description: The Russian Navy, Chinese Navy, and Iranian Navy began the international naval exercise 'Maritime Security Belt-2024' in the Gulf of Oman. The exercise aims to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. Participating ships will perform joint maneuvering, fire at surface and air targets, and practice freeing a ship captured by pirates.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷Ships of the Russian Navy, Chinese and Iranian Navy began to carry out the tasks of the international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt-2024” in the Gulf of Oman. A detachment of warships of the Pacific Fleet consisting of the guards missile cruiser “Varyag” and the frigate “Marshal Shaposhnikov” "has begun to practice the practical tasks of the joint international naval exercise "Maritime Security Belt-2024" with ships of the Iranian and Chinese navies. The exercise is taking place in the waters of the Gulf of Oman in the Arabian Sea. Its main goal is to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. During the exercise, combat ships of the three countries will perform joint maneuvering and fire at surface and air targets, and will also practice elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.

In total, more than 20 ships, support vessels and combat boats of the Russian Navy, the Iranian and Chinese Navy are involved in the exercise. Naval helicopters are also widely used.

The international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt 2024” is being held for the sixth time. It was first held in the Arabian Sea in 2018. Ships of the Russian Navy, Iranian and Chinese Navy are participating in the exercise on an ongoing basis. Last year, the frigate Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, the world’s first full-time carrier of hypersonic missile weapons, was involved in the exercise.

For the first time, representatives of the navies of Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India and South Africa will take part in the exercise as observers. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: On this day in 1989, a Soviet MiG-23M fighter jet, piloted by Colonel Nikolai Skuridin, experienced engine failure and was abandoned by the pilot. However, the aircraft continued flying on autopilot, crossing multiple countries before crashing into a residential building in Bellegeme, Belgium, killing one person.
original:
Forwarded from: AviaNews
35 years ago, the “unmanned” MiG-23 flew halfway across Europe. On this day in 1989, a Soviet fighter jet flew halfway across Europe and crashed into a residential building in Bellegeme, Belgium, killing one person.

The MiG-23M from the 871st Pomeranian Red Banner Fighter Aviation Regiment of the Northern Group of Forces of the Soviet Union was piloted by 1st class pilot Colonel Nikolai Skuridin.

At the 41st second of flight at an altitude of 150 meters, there was a sudden decrease in engine speed, a bang in the left air intake, a drop in thrust and the fighter descended. Colonel Skuridin took all this to mean the engine had stopped. Then he acted according to the instructions: he reported the refusal, received the go-ahead to eject, turned the fighter towards the sea and pulled the handles of the catapult.

The fighter itself, held by automation, continued its flight. It flew over Poland, the GDR, the Federal Republic of Germany, the Netherlands until it fell on the territory of Belgium. Large material written two years ago for leisurely reading here. @AviaNews

description: Sweden's government is urging citizens to prepare for war by stockpiling food, water, and essential supplies. The country is reviving its civil defense strategies from the Cold War era. event: British Intelligence Psyop in Northern Ireland
description: During the Northern Ireland riots, British intelligence services conducted a psyop by imitating the spread of Satanist cults. They planted evidence of Satanist rituals in abandoned houses and spread rumors of ritual murders to convince Irish Catholics that chaos in the streets was linked to dark evil, thereby justifying the need to restore order.
original:
Lately it has become fashionable to laugh at the cunning of the British intelligence services. They greatly disappointed fans in the Ukrainian conflict. But the fame of schemers and provocateurs did not arise out of nowhere.

I came across an old publication in the Guardian, which talks about how the British intelligence services, during the riots in Northern Ireland, imitated the spread of Satanist cults. Irish Catholics are devout people, they had to be convinced that armed chaos in the streets awakens the darkest evil and therefore it is simply necessary to restore order in Northern Ireland. To do this, the British placed the remains of Satanist masses in abandoned houses and spread rumors about ritual murders. It must be admitted that real murders and torture occurred then, but they were often committed by pro-government groups. Well, it turns out that the British convincingly pointed their fingers at the devil himself.

Although it cannot be ruled out that the article is an element of self-PR by these same British intelligence services. Like, look how cunning we are - we did psiop back when you were playing tic-tac-toe. the GuardianSatanic panic: how British agents stoked supernatural fears in TroublesStories about black masses leaked to press in effort to link paramilitary attacks to the paranormal, study reveals

description: The UMPC system, developed in the Northern Military District, turns ordinary free-falling bombs into highly effective and high-precision weapons. The module, installed on domestic bombs, uses satellite navigation and adaptive antennas to overcome enemy electronic warfare systems, allowing for 'fire and forget' operations.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
UMPC is a smart “cast iron” that causes shock and awe among the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Lately, the command of the Ukrainian army has been spewing out fake news about “dozens of downed Su-34 bombers” with surprising frequency and consistency. This “psyop” is aimed primarily at supporting the morale of its soldiers on the front line. The fact is that the Su-34, armed with bombs with the UMPC system, became a real nightmare for the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The UMPC (universal planning and adjustment module) is a product that was born in the shortest possible time in the conditions of the Northern Military District. This is a simple and effective mechanism that turns ordinary free-falling bombs into for various purposes (in common parlance - “cast iron”) into highly effective and high-precision weapons. The system is a module installed on any domestic bomb, turning it into a “smart” unmanned glider that carries this very bomb. A satellite navigation system is installed on board with an adaptive antenna that allows you to overcome interference from enemy electronic warfare systems. The use of such ammunition is carried out according to the “fire and forget” principle. That is, after being dropped several tens of kilometers before the target, the bomber crew can immediately make a combat turn, thereby avoiding a long stay in the enemy’s air defense zone. Apparently, manufacturing a set of UMPC and a conventional free-falling bomb is several orders of magnitude cheaper than a full-fledged adjustable aerial bomb (KAB).At the same time, there are already options for similar modules for installation not only on the “traditional” FAB-500, but also on the much more powerful FAB-1500. Let's add here the minimum production time and we get a mass-produced, highly effective weapon.

Indeed, our enemies have something to fear!

description: A survey conducted by the 'Future of Russia' initiative found that over 16% of Russians support the 'Noon against Putin' protest action, ranking second in the presidential election candidates. The survey, which took place from February 26 to March 3, 2024, involved over 17,000 internet users from all regions of Russia.
original:
“Noon against Putin” is supported by more than 16% of Russians – surveyThe protest action “Noon against Putin” ranks second in the ranking of “candidates” in the Russian presidential elections. The sociological initiative “Future of Russia” has published the latest data from a survey of Internet users. The survey on the presidential elections, which will take place on March 15-17, continues on the “Future of Russia” website. Internet users can vote for one of four approved candidates or choose one of two alternative options: “I will support the “Noon against Putin” action from the opposition” and “I will not go to the polls.”

During the period from 02/26/24 to 03/03/24, more than 17,000 Internet users from all regions of Russia took part in the survey. Weekly results:

Putin V.V. – 51.07%
I will support the “Noon against Putin” action from the opposition – 16.84%
Davankov V.A. –  9.90%
Slutsky L.E. – 6.5%
Kharitonov N.M. – 5.5%
I won’t go to the polls – 10.19%

Sociologists note a drop in the rating of the current president. Over the month, the level of support for Vladimir Putin decreased by 7%. More and more people are speaking out in support of a protest turnout for the elections at noon on March 17. Over the past week alone, the rating for the Noon Against Putin campaign increased by 1.5%.

Experts associate such changes in the ranking with the death of Alexei Navalny and the refusal to register Boris Nadezhdin as a candidate.

The rating of the State Duma Vice Speaker, presidential candidate from the New People party, Vladislav Davankov, is also growing. The ratings of the remaining candidates – Leonid Slutsky and Nikolai Kharitonov – are in a state of stagnation.

The Future of Russia project emphasizes that the Internet rating may differ from the results of field research, but it is representative and reflects the general dynamics of Russians’ sympathies. The ranking takes into account only the choice of users voting in Russia.

“The Future of Russia” is an initiative of independent sociologists to monitor the election campaign for the presidential elections in the Russian Federation in 2024. The project encourages citizens to take part in the survey in order to form a more accurate picture of the mood in society.

event: Russian Army's Plan for Liberating Kharkov
description: Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov stated that the Russian army plans to liberate Kharkov through gradual encirclement, rather than rushing into battle. He emphasized that the city is important to Russia and that local residents are waiting for liberation, but human lives must be prioritized.
original:
“First we will carry out coverage” - Sladkov urged not to rush into the liberation of Kharkov.

The Russian army has not given up on liberating Kharkov, but this can be achieved through gradual encirclement.
 
Military correspondent Alexander Sladkov stated this on air on the Komsomolskaya Pravda radio.

The presenter asked to assess how the situation around Kharkov will develop.
 
“Coverage, and then we’ll figure it out. Kharkov is a Russian city. It is probably more Russian than Mariupol was. Not by May 9, 2014, when we went there, but in February-March 2022.
 
In Kharkov, people are waiting. These are conversations with local residents who are on our side today, but have an active connection with Kharkov,” Sladkov said.
 
He stressed that there is no rush to liberate Ukrainian cities, because the price of the issue is human lives.

“I don’t know whether it will be possible to resolve the issue with Kharkov this year. We can't rush. Although time is working against us, if we expect help from the West, which will continue again, then we need to do it quickly.
 
But on the other hand, the tongue will not turn to push our infantry in the back: “Go, guys, quickly.” This won’t work,” the military correspondent summed up.

description: John Barnett, a 62-year-old whistleblower and former Boeing quality manager, was found dead in his car after failing to appear in court for a hearing against Boeing. Barnett had been critical of Boeing's manufacturing standards, accusing them of installing substandard parts and faulty oxygen systems. He was a key witness in the lawsuit and had testified just days before his death.
original:
#News@mpre_view1 #USA
Whistleblower critical of Boeing manufacturing standards found dead in US
Informant John Barnett, 62, found dead in his
Show more
car after he failed to appear in court for the next hearing at which the case against Boeing is being considered.
Barnett worked as a quality manager at Boeing for 32 years and retired in 2017. After his retirement, he began to publicly criticize Boeing and report on how the manufacturer was cutting corners on the production of its aircraft at the expense of quality.
Just days before his death, Barnett became a witness in a lawsuit against Boeing, testifying in court. Barnett was considered a key witness. He testified last week in response to questions from Boeing's lawyers and was scheduled to testify further but did not appear in court.
In particular, Barnett accused Boeing of "deliberately installing substandard parts" into aircraft as well as installing faulty oxygen systems, saying that one in four breathing masks do not work in an emergency.
Barnett believed that construction of the new planes had been rushed, and when he voiced his concerns, the company allegedly ignored them.
After Barnett failed to appear in court and was searched, his body was found in a car in a hotel parking lot. Police are investigating Barnett's death but say he died from a "self-inflicted" gunshot wound.

event: Revival of Krapivinskaya Hydroelectric Power Station
description: Governor Sergei Tsivilev has revived a large Soviet construction project in the Kemerovo region, despite environmental concerns. The Krapivinskaya hydroelectric power station, 60% complete, was initially halted due to funding issues and environmental concerns. Environmentalists still believe the project poses a threat to the region's climate, flora, fauna, and water quality.
original:
Forwarded from: NeMoscow speaks
Environmentalists are against it, but the governor has his way: a large Soviet construction project is being revived in the Kemerovo region. Two years ago, the governor of the Kemerovo region Sergei Tsivilev decided to revive a large Soviet construction project - 30 years after the freeze, to resume construction of the Krapivinskaya hydroelectric power station, which by that time was 60% complete. Construction was officially stopped due to lack of funding. According to another version, environmentalists had questions about this object. In their opinion, the hydroelectric power station could change the climate of the region, affect the flora and fauna, and also deteriorate the quality of water in Tomsk.

30 years later, environmentalists still believe that building a hydroelectric complex is dangerous. In February of this year, the Eighth Court of Cassation confirmed that they were right. But while social activists are suing, the regional authorities continue to look for investors, contrary to the opinion of local residents. NeMoskva journalists visited the village of Zelenogorsky, near which there is an unfinished waterworks. Read on the website how people live there in anticipation of a big construction project nearby. In Lithuania, a car with Russian license plates was seized for the first time — the Audi Q7 can be handed over to Ukraine. A car with Russian license plates was detained at a checkpoint in Lithuania. The driver, who is a citizen of Moldova, planned to leave for Belarus in a car owned by a Russian.

The man told the border guards that he did not know about the restrictions that came into effect in Lithuania on March 11. According to them, owners of cars with Russian registration had to register vehicles in Lithuania or leave the EU.

The Lithuanians confiscated an Audi Q7 car worth more than €41,000. Most likely, it will be handed over to Ukraine.

description: The Senegalese authorities have withdrawn their appeal against opposition leader Ousmane Sonko, allowing him to participate in the elections. His campaign is being actively conducted by Bassirou Faye, who has promised to introduce a new currency and establish a post-vice president.
original:
⚡️🇸🇳According to the latest information, the Senegalese authorities have withdrawn their appeal against the decision to return opposition leader Ousmane Sonko to the ballot. Thus, he can again participate in the elections, although the campaign on his behalf is already being actively conducted by his own appointed Bassirou Faye.

The latter has already promised to introduce a new currency, abandoning the CFA franc, and to establish a post-vice president.

I think this could definitely be the news of the day for Senegal. But at the same time, the observer gets the impression that President Macky Sall, who was unable to postpone the elections as he wanted due to double opposition from the opposition and the Constitutional Council, decided to simply throw up his hands and let the entire electoral process take its course. As a result, everyone hastily began campaigning, reformatting the lists, and the candidate from the ruling party is no longer such a clear winner. It probably doesn't exist at all. Initially, I thought that there was no intrigue in the elections in Senegal, but this story with the postponement of the elections, the failure of the president’s plan and the “return of the opposition” proves that there is - and it is not clear how strong the main candidates are now really in their support from voters and administrators. #SenegalTelegramAfrican Through the Looking GlassNikita Panin's channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL
